intro: Pteroneurum graecum, commonly known as the Greek pteroneurum, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Pteroneurum graecum is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in both horticulture and ecological research.
